item.description: A hack to detect if an element is visible/not: const isVisible = (el) => (el.offsetWidth || el.offsetHeight) > 0; see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1343237/how-to-check-elements-visibility-via-javascript

That you can group fields in an html form with a <fieldset> tag, and that it accepts a top-level child <legend> tag. Together, <fieldset> <legend>Legend</legend> <div>...</div> </fieldset> produces ┌────legend─────┐ │ │ │ │ │ ... │ │ │ │ │ └───────────────┘ which is simultaneously cool and hard to style.

That you need to set a value="number" attribute AND a max="number" attribute on a html <progress> element in order to display fractional progress. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/progress
